selective.intro: The diagram shows a section through a red blood cell.
selective.question: How is the structure of the cell related to its function?
options: The cell has no nucleus to use up oxygen.
The cell membrane has a small surface area in relation to volume.
The flat structure makes it easier to be carried through arteries.
selective.explanation:
The correct answer is: The cytoplasm contains haemoglobin. 
Blood cells carry oxygen to different parts of the body. Oxygen is required for aerobic respiration in organs. Red blood cells can transport oxygen around the body because oxygen binds to haemoglobin. These cells do not have nuclei to allow room for haemoglobin. 
Red blood cells have a biconcave shape to maximise the efficiency oxygen absorption. A biconcave shape increases the surface area in relation to volume.
